intro: Psychotria iringensis, commonly known as the Iringa Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
